action.action-desc: Mr. Johnson of Georgia (for himself and Mr. Clay) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide a penalty for violent crimes by certain State or local law enforcement officers, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Police Accountability Act of 2014
.

section.header: Violent crimes by certain State or local law enforcement officers

subsection.text: Chapter 1 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Violent crimes by certain State or local law enforcement officers

subsection.text: Whoever, being a State or local law enforcement officer in a public agency which receives Federal justice assistance engages in any conduct that, were the conduct to occur in the special maritime and territorial jurisdiction of the United States, would constitute a Federal crime of violence, shall be punished as is provided for that offense under Federal law.

paragraph.text: the term State or local law enforcement officer means an employee of a State or local government—

subparagraph.text: who has statutory authority to make arrests or apprehensions;
who is authorized by the agency of the employee to carry firearms; and

clause.text: engagement in or supervision of the prevention, detection, investigation, or prosecution of, or the incarceration of any person for, any violation of law; or
the protection of Federal, State, local, or foreign government officials against threats to personal safety; and

paragraph.text: the term State or local government means the government—

subparagraph.text: of a State, the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, or any other territory or possession of the United States; or
of a political subdivision of such a State, District, Commonwealth, territory or possession.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 1 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 28. Violent crimes by certain State or local law enforcement officers.
